subject: Re: response to the sceptic link on my images
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
Hi Bruce. I thought the images in your IAH gallery were very intriguing when I first saw 
them, seems like over a year ago.  I didn't realize they were already posted here, nor that 
wouldn't want a link to them posted.  Sorry about that.  

I do think the person on the other site brought up some valid concerns over how much 
enhancement has taken place, but as you pointed out, you have stated step by step what 
your process is so this allows others to freely decide to what degree they feel the original 
content has been altered.

I, myself, have been accused of photoshopping my images.  The main difference being 
that I haven't done anything except for crop them from the larger frame in which they 
were originally seen.  The colors and images are as they were discovered during the review 
process.

And like yourself, I'm into the two-way stuff now.  I still squeeze in a few sessions here 
and there, but my ITC work has definitely taken a temporary back seat to other research.  

Margaret

proclaimed photoshop expert and claimed my images were touched up.
> So I gave him a raw image of mine and asked him to come up with the same result. That 
was the last I heard from him.
>  
> I did not put these images up to have to defend them, I just thought because of the 
interest that arose regarding Margaret's images 
> reminded me of my itc days, which are now long gone. My only interest is box research.
>  
> I don't feel it was necessary to did up that idiots website and post the link with my IAH 
gallery, I did not post these pictures 
> to prove anything just for curiosity sake.
